snippet: The Falkland Islands are likely to maintain ties to Britain in a vote that has provoked an aggressive stand by Argentina, which also claims the territory.
abstract: Inhabitants of the Falkland Islands are going to the polls to vote on a referendum on the island's future and whether to remain an overseas territory of Great Britain or to begin transition to Argentine control; local pundits say voters are most likely to maintain ties to Britain.

byline.contributor: Emily Schmall contributed reporting from Buenos Aires.

lead_paragraph: The Falkland Islands are likely to maintain ties to Britain in a vote that has provoked an aggressive stand by Argentina, which also claims the territory.

headline.seo: Before Falklands Vote, Argentine and British Hostility
headline.main: Before a Falklands Vote, Bad Blood Surges Anew
headline.print_headline: Before a Falklands Vote, Bad Blood Surges Anew
